parameters.name: Number of Threads
parameters.description: Number of threads to use for parallel processing.

parameters.name: Reuse Calibration
parameters.description: AlphaDIA will save the calibration parameters in the project file. If this option is enabled, the calibration parameters will be reused for subsequent searches of the same file.

parameters.name: Reuse Ion Quantities
parameters.description: AlphaDIA will save the quantification results in the project file. If this option is enabled, the quantiitative features will be reused for subsequent searches of the same file.

parameters.name: Use Astral MS1
parameters.description: AlphaDIA will use the Astral detector for MS1 information, if available.

parameters.name: Log Level
parameters.description: Log level for the console output.

parameters.name: Save Library
parameters.description: Store the library as alphaBase HDF file. This will speed up subsequent searches and will include predicted properties.

parameters.name: Channel Filter
parameters.description: Comma separated list eg. 1,2,3. Only precursors with matching channels will be loaded. Leave empty to load all available channels.

parameters.name: Exclude Shared Ions
parameters.description: When searching a multiplexed sample some fragment ions are not specific for a single channel. If this option is enabled, these ions will be excluded from the search.

parameters.name: Number of Candidates
parameters.description: Number of candidates to extract per precursor.

parameters.name: MS1 Tolerance
parameters.description: MS1 tolerance in ppm. Search windows are optimized and calibrated during processing. The window is reduced until this tolerance is reached.

parameters.name: MS2 Tolerance
parameters.description: MS2 tolerance in ppm. Search windows are optimized and calibrated during processing. The window is reduced until this tolerance is reached.

parameters.name: Mobility Tolerance
parameters.description: Mobility tolerance in 1/K_0. Search windows are optimized and calibrated during processing. The window is reduced until this tolerance is reached.

parameters.name: RT Tolerance
parameters.description: Retention time tolerance in seconds. Search windows are optimized and calibrated during processing. The window is reduced until this tolerance is reached.

parameters.name: FDR
parameters.description: Maximum false discovery rate for PSMs.

parameters.name: Grouping Level
parameters.description: Grouping level for FDR correction.

parameters.name: Competetive Scoring
parameters.description: If enabled, only the best scoring candidate per target decoy pair is retained.

parameters.name: Channel wise FDR
parameters.description: In the initial pass before propagating identifications the FDR is calculated for each channel separately. This can be usefull if the composition of the channels differs drastically.

parameters.name: Keep Decoys
parameters.description: If enabled, decoy PSMs will be retained in the output.

parameters.name: Number of Candidates
parameters.description: Initial number of candidates to extract per precursor.

parameters.name: MS1 Tolerance
parameters.description: Initial MS1 tolerance in ppm.

parameters.name: MS2 Tolerance
parameters.description: Initial MS2 tolerance in ppm.

parameters.name: Mobility Tolerance
parameters.description: Initial mobility tolerance in 1/K_0.

parameters.name: RT Tolerance
parameters.description: Initial retention time tolerance in seconds.

parameters.name: Enable Multiplexing
parameters.description: Quantify and score identification across non-isobaric labled channels.

parameters.name: Target Channels
parameters.description: Target channels contain regular samples and are used for quantification.

parameters.name: Decoy Channel
parameters.description: Non-existant channel used for decoy identifications.

parameters.name: Reference Channel
parameters.description: The reference channel is only used for guiding identification and is not used for quantification. Some features will be calculated with respect to the reference channel.

parameters.name: Competetive Scoring
parameters.description: If enabled, only the best scoring candidate per target decoy pair is retained.
